com.esri.mo2.ui.bean
Interface RendererHandler

public interface RendererHandler

Allows you to add Renderer types to the RendererEditor of the Layer bean.

Method Summary
 JComponent getCustomEditor()
          Returns a Component that can be used within the CustomRendererEditor.
 String getName()
          Returns a name to be shown in the IDE's tabbed display.
 void setRenderer(FeatureLayer layer, String details)
          Sets the underlying Renderer that can be used as a feature Renderer within a Layer.
 

Method Detail

setRenderer

public void setRenderer(FeatureLayer layer,
                        String details)
                 throws IOException
Sets the underlying Renderer that can be used as a feature Renderer within a Layer.

Parameters:
layer - the FeatureLayer object
details - information needed to access various data sources. See Layer.setDataset for the content and format of this string.
Throws:
IOException

getCustomEditor

public JComponent getCustomEditor()
Returns a Component that can be used within the CustomRendererEditor. The purpose of this component is to prepare a "Renderer details" String that will modify a Layer's Renderer property, and will eventually be used by the setRenderer method within this interface.

This JComponent is expected to call putClientProperty() when the Dataset details have been chosen by the end-user using the key "new". It is also expected to respond to a PropertyChangeEvent having key "set", that is signalled when the IDE sets the property value into the user interface.

See Also:
getName()

getName

public String getName()
Returns a name to be shown in the IDE's tabbed display.
